channel.title: 365 days with mxmtoon
channel.description: “365” is a daily podcast brought to you by mxmtoon, artist/songwriter/actor/designer/gamer/simp, who will take you through the most interesting, weird, and funny events of that day in history. You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, and you’ll learn a ton of new things. Episodes released daily starting September 14. Please Follow and Subscribe! Distributed by Talkhouse.

channel.content:encoded: “365” is a daily podcast brought to you by mxmtoon, artist/songwriter/actor/designer/gamer/simp, who will take you through the most interesting, weird, and funny events of that day in history. You’ll laugh, you’ll cry, and you’ll learn a ton of new things. Episodes released daily starting September 14. Please Follow and Subscribe! Distributed by Talkhouse.

item.title: special episode: how disco (briefly) took over the world
item.description: In this special episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the history of disco, a music genre that started out as a response to the counterculture movement of the 1960s and turned into a dance craze and subculture that perpetuates to this day. Then, Maia will tell us all about her new single, called “sad disco.” Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: september 10: this is the story all about how Will Smith’s life got flipped turned upside down (with Ant Saunders)
item.description: In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the debut of The Fresh Prince of Bel Air, an early 1990s sitcom about a teen who moves in with his wealthy aunt and uncle in a mansion in Bel-Air, California. The sitcom skyrocketed star Will Smith to stardom, and was one of the first mainstream television shows to center on Black teenagehood. After, she is joined by guest Ant Sanders. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: september 6: first ship to sail around the world

After, Maia revisits Elton John’s 1988 “garage sale” auctioning off over 2,000 of his personal belongings. item.title: september 5: mother teresa
item.description: In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about life and legend of Mother Teresa. After, Maia revisits the 1964 hit single “House of the Rising Sun” by the Animals. The song is based on old traditional folk tunes and was the first “folk rock” hit. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: september 4: the birth of los angeles
item.description: In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the day Los Angeles was founded, and the winding path of riches, violence, theft, and cinema that built that great city. After, Maia discusses the day in 2002 when Kelly Clarkson became the first-ever American Idol winner -- and an entire genre of American television launched. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: september 2: london on fire
item.description: In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the Great Fire of London in 1666 and some unexpectedly eerie comparisons to our modern response to crises. item.title: september 1: a sad farewell to passenger pigeons
item.description: In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the shockingly swift extinction of passenger pigeons, formerly one of the world’s largest species of bird. She also discusses how it spawned the earliest conservation movements, and what we can do today to protect endangered species. After, Maia revisits the grand opening of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: august 29: hurricane katrina slams into new orleans
item.description:
In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the day in history when Hurricane Katrina put 80% of New Orleans under water. After, Maia discusses the big events of the 2004 MTV Video Music Awards. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms.
As we speak, Louisiana is reeling from Hurricane Ida, which hit on the 16th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina. You can help by visiting https://www.shreveportvolunteernetwork.com/, a local organization assisting those in need. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: june 20: Just when you thought it was safe to get back in the water…
item.description: In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the release of the film Jaws, a 1975 Steven Spielberg thriller and massive hit. The movie, which was Spielberg’s first big film, became the first summer blockbuster, and set the stage for Hollywood’s predilection for high-budget, high-return action-adventure films during the season. After, Maia reflects on a Brockhampton release. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. item.title: june 17: lady liberty crosses the atlantic
item.description: In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the Statue of Liberty, which arrived (in pieces) in New York today in 1885. The statue was a gift from France as a memorial to the United States’s independence as a nation — it now sits in the New York Harbor, and is an internationally recognized symbol of freedom and liberty. After, she reflects on the 2008 release of the debut Katy Perry album, One of the Boys. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: may 3: Anne Frank and the secret annex
item.description: Today on 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia tells the story of Anne Frank, a Jewish teenager who perished in the Holocaust. Anne spent two years hiding in a secret annex in a house in Amsterdam, and documented her time in hiding in a journal. Maia will discuss her life, tragic death at a Nazi concentration camp, and the impact of her diary and story. Afterwards, Maia talks about the album that made Fall Out Boy go mainstream. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.description: Today on 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the day the United States acquired its very first submarine, which made traveling beneath the surface of the ocean possible. item.title: april 5: Winston Churchill hangs up his homburg [hosted by: Ricky Montgomery]
item.description: Today on 365 days with mxmtoon, Ricky talks about the resignation of Winston Churchill, who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1940 to 1945 — i.e. during the Second World War — and again from 1951 to 1955, and was a towering and controversial figure in British history. Afterwards, he talks about the release of Lil Nas X’s smash hit, the “Old Town Road” remix with Billy Ray Cyrus. item.title: march 28: Jesse Owens wins the gold (with Sofía Valdés)
item.description: Today on 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the career of Olympian Jesse Owens, who, as a Black track and field athlete, won four gold medals for the U.S. at the 1936 Olympics in what was then a Nazi regime in Berlin. Afterwards, she is joined by guest Sofía Valdés and talks about the 2020 “Twitch Aid” concert that raised money for victims of the coronavirus pandemic. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: march 11: the history of pandemic 1.0
item.description: Today on 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the OG pandemic: The Spanish Influenza of 1918. Over the course of two years, the Spanish Flu killed 675,000 Americans and 50 million people worldwide — Maia digs into the flu’s history and the lessons gleaned from that pandemic. Afterwards, she talks about Corpse’s hit track, “Cat Girls Are Ruining My Life.” Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: february 25: oxygenless parasite
item.description: Today on 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about the discovery of the first animal that doesn’t require oxygen to breathe — a tiny parasite called Henneguya salminicola. Then, Maia talks about how on this day in 1970, a lovable muppet named Ernie sang a song about his "Rubber Duckie" on Sesame Street for the first time, prompting the song to later be released as a single. item.title: october 25: sit in for justice
item.description:
Getting arrested isn’t always a bad thing. As John Lewis so eloquently said, "Get in good trouble, necessary trouble, and help redeem the soul of America."
Sometimes it means that the laws are wrong and you’re fighting for civil rights. At least in the case of Martin Luther King Jr, who was sentenced to four months in jail on October 25th, 1960, after participating in a student protest at a department store in Atlanta. Maia talks about the arrest itself, as well as the student sit in protests writ large. We also get a music fact about Richard Nixon—yep, you read that right! Tune in to hear what it is. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 24: farewell to the pony express
item.description: Which do you like better, horses or instant messaging? Okay, weird question. I ask because in this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia talks about how the transcontinental telegraph replaced the Pony Express and revolutionized communication as we know it. Maia also reminisces about the first release of one of our favorite pop stars. item.title: october 17: when the earth quaked for baseball
item.description: October 17th was the day that shook the World... Series. On today’s episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia explains why the 1989 World Series game is now dubbed as the “earthquake series” and the aftermath that came with it. Ten years later the world was shook again. Well, maybe not the entire world but a small crowd in Barnstaple, England thought they were going to a secret show to see one of the smoothest criminals in music. The crime - it was an imposter. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: october 16: guess who’s coming to dinner
item.description: We all love a good dinner party filled with friends and family. Laughing and playful banter fill the atmosphere of the room, while good food is served for everyone to enjoy. But what happens when things don’t go as planned. In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares just the time when a White House dinner party did not go accordingly. Speaking of things that do not go according to plan, Maia shares the tale of a band’s split following the failure of their most recent album, Mardi Gras. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: october 15: the eye of the panther
item.description: When you hear the phrase ‘Black Panther’ you probably think of the 2018 Marvel film with Chadwick Boseman and Michael B. Jordan. But actually, Black Panther has a greater significance in society than just being the definition to a movie. In another round of Civil Rights history, the Black Panther Party's purpose is to gain justice for Black Americans and other oppressed groups in the US. Maia shares just how important they are not only in progressing societal knowledge, but as well in educational knowledge. In addition to this, Maia reminds us of that one time when we all woke up with a new U2 album downloaded onto our Apple devices and who apologized for the unwarranted library addition. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 14: a Nobel prize for a Noble man
item.description: You may know this man from his famous speech ‘I have a dream’ or his many contributions to human rights, but did you know that he received a Nobel Peace Prize? That's right! Martin Luther King Jr. not only received the Nobel Peace Prize but set history with being the youngest man and second Black man to receive the Nobel. In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia will share why MLK received this great honor and as well refresh us on some history of why King is so important to society today. Speaking of important individuals in society, Frank Sinatra may come to some minds as being an inspiration to music today. But did you know that he was part of the mafia?! Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 13: isolation, underground style (with Sizzy Rocket)
item.description: On each episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, we know that Maia digs into different history facts that happened on that specific day. But for today’s episode, let's just say that we are literally digging in. Back in 2010, 33 men experienced something like we are experiencing now: isolation. However, their isolation looked a little different than ours. Where we are stuck in our homes, these 33 men were stuck in a cave 2,300 feet underground with no way to communicate with the outside world. Yikes! You will not want to miss this episode of finding out what happened to these men and also hearing from our special guest Sizzy Rocket! Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 12: the original sausage party (with Dayglow)
item.description: Oh Oktoberfest… A time where you have the excuse to drink lots of beer, eat good food, and for men to wear lederhosen. But how did this celebration in Europe gain its roots? On this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares the origin Oktoberfest, which oddly enough started as a celebration of marriage. Along with this, Maia tells of another type of festival which holds as a memorable moment for fellow artist Dayglow - the time when Dayglow performed his first festival at Austin City Limits! Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 11: man on the moon? more like woman in space
item.description: Kathryn Sullivan changed the game for women around the world. Not only did she prove that women could be more than just girlfriends, wives, or secretaries, but that they could take part in research that changed beyond how we look at the world and into space! In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares how Kathryn Sullivan became the first woman to walk in space and eventually be inaugurated into the Astronaut Hall of Fame. In addition to this, Maia shares the tale of a special artist's journey to hosting and performing on SNL. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 7: the mysterious death of a mystery writer
item.description: Oooo a murder mystery… spooky! In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares the strange story of how Edgar Allan Poe died. Known for writing gothic horror and mystery novels, how perplexing is it that his death is a mystery as well! But moving onto the musical fact of the day, which we are glad is not a mystery, is the launch of Spotify! Spotify needs no explanation for how it has shaped artist platforms and the music industry; rather, Maia gives details to how it became popularized in the United States and where the name “Spotify” comes from. item.title: october 5: the time the President went on tv
item.description: Once upon a time, people used radios in order to consume music, news, weather reports, and even sporting events. The lack of having a visual to watch was made up with the story being created in the listeners mind. This all changed though when the integration of TVs were popularized in homes - specifically when it comes to political commentary. Now, viewers could see televised speeches and elections broadcasted in their living rooms; some good, some bad, and some very bad. On today’s episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares the first time the president went on TV. Along with this famous milestone, Maia as well shares the first of many milestones renowned artist Beyoncé created, starting with her nine-week run on the US singles chart with “Baby Boy”. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 4: up in the air (with Amy Allen)
item.description: We all remember the history lesson about the Wright brothers, but may have forgotten why they are so important. Well, on today’s episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares their key invention that has transformed the way we travel: airplanes. As soon as the airplane was invented, things were looking up (get it?). Our way of transportation has majorly transformed because of the testing the Wright brothers did to ensure long lasting flight abilities; without planes, we would still be on boats traveling from country to country. As for our musical fact of the day, we have a special guest who you should definitely know about. She has co-written a number of incredible songs, including “Back To You” by Selena Gomez and “Adore You” by Harry Styles. Here she is today, talking about her 2018 release with Halsey - give it up for Amy Allen! Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 3: if it doesn’t fit…
item.description: It was a theater performance streamed across the nation. Millions of viewers tuned in to watch the trial of O.J. Simpson, a former football star, be prosecuted for the murder of his ex-wife Nicole Brown Simpson and her friend Ronald Goldman. In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares the details of court actions against O.J. Simpson that left him stalled in his career, a running joke for decades, and leading a police chase through Los Angeles. In the theme of people being stalled in their career, Maia shares headlines about the retaliation Irish singer Sinead O’Connor made when she ripped up a picture of Pope John Paul II while performing on Saturday Night Live. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 2: on justice and the police (with Gia Woods)
item.description: Being sworn into the Supreme Court is a major accomplishment to add to your resume of life. But for Thurgood Marshall, being sworn into the nation's highest court was not just a major achievement for himself, but a leading step forward in society. On this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia reveals the reason why Thurgood Marshall is a pivotal character in our nation's history. He influenced not just those around him, but inspired a generation of individuals younger than him to step up and be courageous in their search for justice. In addition to this, Maia as well shares the story of a musical figure who is the voice behind the band’s biggest hits, like “Don’t Stand So Close to Me” and “Every Breath You Take.” You might not know him by his real name, but he sure does fly like a butterfly and sting like a bee. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: october 1: rocket men and rocket man
item.description: Three, two, one, lift off! In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares the tale of how NASA became the United States’ official space exploration organization. Now, this was a major event in U.S. history and did not come without its challenges. Rivalry between the Soviet Union and the United States led to one of the most famous competitions in history: the space race. All of this was in an effort to show off who was leading in technology and science, which ultimately led to launching the first man into space. Speaking of launching a person into space… Maia shares a fun music fact about a different kind of Rocket Man, who on this day was honored in the Madison Square Garden Hall of Fame. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: september 30: how Botswana became its own country (with Carly Rae Jepsen)
item.description: Independence Day - a time of gathering together to watch fireworks, eat good food, and celebrate with friends. But Independence Day has a greater symbolic meaning than just commemoration with friends and family. On this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares the reasoning to why September 30th is so special for the country Botswana - it’s their day of independence from the United Kingdom! But how did they gain their freedom and even end up in the control of the U.K.? Maia gives all the details of this special moment in history, and celebrates Botswana for their self-rule. Speaking of special moments, today we have a special guest joining us for our musical segment: Carly Rae Jespen! Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: september 29: how the world almost ended
item.description: There was quite a panic when the Mayan’s predicted the world would end back in 2012. In today’s episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia teaches us about the time the world almost did end in 2004. Although unpredicted, the asteroid 4179 Toutatis did get a little too close for comfort. Luckily, we’re all still here and far from an apocalyptic scare. In the theme of supposide ends, Maia also reveals the beef between 50 Cent and Kanye that almost ended one of their careers. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: september 28: how Trevor Noah got from Soweto, South Africa to The Daily Show
item.description: We all know the feeling of being attached to a TV or movie character, and hating when they leave the show. This is especially true when it comes to our news anchors, as they are a crucial part of our life and history. Television hosts become a special part of our daily life because… well… they provide us with the news. item.title: september 27: the ongoing history of school integration
item.description: If recent events have shown us anything, they’ve demonstrated how much work is still to be done when it comes to racial equality across the globe. Part of progressing is deeply embedded in understanding the past, and so today Maia discusses a critical moment in history when schools were integrated for the first time. Also on today’s episode of 365 days of mxmtoon, we’re brought back to 2013 (ah, simpler times) to revisit the release date of the album that propelled 16-year-old Ella Yelich-O’Connor to stardom (better known by her stage name...can you guess who?). item.title: september 26: on gramophones and hip-hop rock
item.description: Streaming services have revolutionized the way we listen to music. But before we had these platforms, how did we tune in? Let's rewind back before the radio, cassettes, or CDs, and take a look at the record player. In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares the history of how German immigrant Emile Berliner found inspiration to improve upon Thomas Edison’s invention of the phonograph. Berliner’s improvement became known as the gramophone, which we commonly call the record player. This was world changing for the music industry, creating accessibility for people all around the world to hear music that was available to them live. Speaking of the music industry, on this day the first hip hop group hit the Billboard Top 10 with their third album, which led them to be inducted into the Library of Congress. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: september 25: the first anti-smoking psa
item.description: Regardless of your habits, there’s no denying it...cigarettes are bad for you. But would you believe that we were actually warned about these adverse health effects as early as 1878? Talk about unheeded warnings! In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia takes us back to that fateful day in 1878 and also walks us through the history of tobacco and how it skyrocketed in popularity across the globe. Speaking of hype, Maia will also explore one very popular Pink Floyd record that was able to skyrocket on the US charts. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: september 24: the time Donald Trump was impeached (and nothing happened)
item.description: It was a cultural reset. Trump won the presidential election against Hilary Clinton that sent the world population into shock (cue jaws dropping). Theories were made and speculations were voiced about how our “current” president became, well… president. On this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia discusses the fishy tale around how Trump came to presidency and an impeachment accusation that could have taken him out. Along with this, Maia reveals the history of the iconic song “Smells Like Teen Spirit” and what the album cover art is all about. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: september 23: how Nintendo went from a Japanese card shop to...Nintendo
item.description: Mario, Luigi, Zelda, Tom Nook...all household names we have to thank for hundreds of hours of entertainment - and because of one Japanese businessman and a company called Nintendo. But even though your GameBoy or Wii was the most high-tech thing you could’ve dreamed up when you opened it on Christmas morning, the first Nintendo products were actually much more simplistic...they were handmade playing cards! On this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, we’ll hear about the journey that took Nintendo’s playing cards all the way to some of the most sought-after pieces of technology in the world. Also, Maia will clue us in on an absurd period of time when the world was convinced that musical legend Paul McCartney wasn’t who he said he was. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: september 22: how the dead sea scrolls got online
item.description: What do you get when you have a group of Bedouin teenagers and goats hanging out near the caves of the Dead Sea? Well, on this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, we learn that through a lost goat and an adventurous teenager, the discovery of the oldest biblical manuscripts in the world were found. As Maia shares further details of the story, we learn that these major archaeological finds were at one point not seen as significant. Alongside this story, Maia also shares a heartfelt musical history story of a fundraising concert that produced over $200 million dollars! Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: september 21: the mysterious existence of Stonehenge
item.description: As much as we love facts and history on this podcast, we’re always down for a good alien conspiracy theory. On today’s episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia does a deep dive on the many theories surrounding the prehistoric Stonehenge - including the extraterrestrial ones - and the many times it was bought and resold by British royalty. Speaking of expensive purchases and British legends, we’ll also hear about the auction that sold one of The Beatles’ contracts for a pretty penny, and the cultural significance surrounding that contract. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: september 19: the untold history of emojis
item.description: Wait...there existed a time before an emoji existed to convey every thought and emotion our brains could formulate? Who are we without :) and :(? On this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia takes us back to a 1982 college message board to explore the roots of our favorite keyboard accessories. I mean c’mon, where else would the emoji be born if not amongst college students? For those of us missing live music, we’ll also be transported back to Central Park 1981 for the highest attended concert of its time (Hint: This iconic duo had no need for emojis in giving us all the feels on “Bridge Over Troubled Water”). Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: september 18: on big comets and bigger pop stars
item.description: Twinkle, twinkle, little, wait is that a comet? On today's episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia will be sharing a time when astronomers Kaoru Ikeya and Tsutomu Seki founded a comet with just their naked eye! No telescopes were used during this night sighting because of how close the comet was to the sun. As Maia goes into detail about this one-of-a-kind event, she will also share another trendsetting milestone in music history. Here’s a hint: Cause the players gonna play and the haters gonna hate, but you better not shake off listening to this podcast. item.title: september 17: the story of Vanessa Williams, the first black miss america
item.description: She is beauty, she is grace, she is...stripped of her title for some sexist “scandal”? For Vanessa Williams, the first Black woman to be crowned Miss America in 1983, the scrutiny women (especially WOC!) are subject to while in the spotlight is all too familiar. Talk about a double standard! Despite unfair pageant practices, Williams emerged stronger than ever, highlighting her resilience and overall “badass-ery”. Then, Maia brings up another “scandal” involving The Ed Sullivan Show and a famous song from The Doors. Join this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms. Distributed by Talkhouse. Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: september 16: how Mexico got its independence from Spain
item.description: Hold up. You're telling us that Cinco de Mayo is not the day for the best deals on tacos and margaritas? Yep, you read that right; Cinco de Mayo is actually more important than filling our stomachs. In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, we learn about the true significance of May 5th, which actually all came down to Catholic priest Father Miguel Hidalgo. Along with this, Maia talks about how hip hop was integrated into mainstream music. item.title: september 15: the day the Supreme Court got its first woman justice
item.description: Can you believe that America’s first woman justice wasn’t appointed until 1981? In today’s episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia breaks out the history books and does a deep dive into the life and career of Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day O’Connor. item.title: september 14: the time we skipped 11 days into the future
item.description: You can shift time?! In this episode of 365 days with mxmtoon, Maia shares a piece of history that only the Jonas Brothers thought to be true - Time Travel. No time machines were involved, but the switching of how we keep track of time did. Through the conversion of calendars, Maia explains how Pope Gregory XIII introduced this new way of keeping track of our days and how Benjamin Franklin seemed to dig it. Maia also shares a secret story about the Rolling Stones. Listen to this episode today and make sure you’re following along with the daily updates @365daysmxmtoon on all platforms.
